A **scroll of light** is a type of [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Messages](#Messages)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.2 xNetHack](#xNetHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Description

Reading a noncursed scroll of light will created a radius of permanent light around you—an uncursed scroll creates light in a 5-square radius, while a blessed scroll creates a 9-unit radius of light. Reading a cursed scroll of light instead darkens a 5-square area around you. In either case, the scroll will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify").

Reading the scroll of light while confused will create a radius of darkness corresponding to the scroll's [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") around you. However, they also have a 1⁄5 chance of summoning a [light monster](/wiki/Light_\(monster_class\) "Light (monster class)")—reading noncursed scrolls while confused can summon a [yellow light](/wiki/Yellow_light "Yellow light"), while the cursed scroll can summon a [black light](/wiki/Black_light "Black light"). The scroll will not auto-identify if it creates a monster.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 5d3e237f](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/5d3e237ffc6e39bf53ae006cd6d610973f8ffd77), [Izchak](/wiki/Izchak "Izchak") may stock scrolls of light in his shop.

Reading the scroll while confused instead summons multiple [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") lights. An uncursed scroll will summon 3–4 yellow lights; a blessed scroll will summon 5–6 yellow lights; and a cursed scroll will summon 3–4 black lights. Nothing will be summoned if the appropriate type of light is [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").

Per [commit e8341dc9](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/e8341dc9d79dbdc0013a287a9c8dfd627798883b), reading cursed and blessed scrolls of light while not confused may respectively decrease or increase the beatitude status of [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword"), [gold dragon scales](/wiki/Gold_dragon_scales "Gold dragon scales"), and [gold dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gold_dragon_scale_mail "Gold dragon scale mail").

## Strategy

While a scroll useful for lighting up a single room, the [wand of light](/wiki/Wand_of_light "Wand of light") and the [light](/wiki/Spellbook_of_light "Spellbook of light") spell tend to be more efficient, as is any light source [tool](/wiki/Tool "Tool"). A player that has a consistent source of lighting can reliably save this scroll for [blanking](/wiki/Blank_scroll "Blank scroll").

## History

The scroll of light has been present in the game since *Hack 1.21*, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"). The confused reading of a scroll creating a yellow or black light was added in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0")—variants based on previous versions retain the usual behavior for confused readings, though this is not always the case.

## Messages

- A lit field surrounds you!

  You read a blessed or uncursed scroll.

- You are surrounded by darkness!

  You read a cursed scroll, or a scroll of any beatitude while confused.

* Your \<light source> goes out!

  You read a cursed scroll or read any scroll of light while confused, and your lit [lamp](/wiki/Lamp "Lamp") or [lantern](/wiki/Lantern "Lantern") went out.

* Your \<candle>'s flame is extinguished.

  As above, with a [candle](/wiki/Candle "Candle").

* Suddenly, the only light left comes from Sunsword!

  As above, but you are wielding [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

- Lights appear all around you!

  You read the scroll while confused and summoned lights. This auto-identifies the scroll if you can see any of the lights.

- Tiny lights sparkle in the air momentarily.

  You read the scroll while confused, but lights could not be summoned because they are genocided.

- The ambient light seems dimmer.

  You read a cursed scroll of light while not confused. This replaces the Sunsword message above.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), reading a scroll of light while confused has a different effect than reading a cursed scroll. If blessed or uncursed, it will summon 5–10 [yellow lights](/wiki/Yellow_light "Yellow light") scattered throughout the level. If the scroll is cursed, it will instead summon up to 15 [black lights](/wiki/Black_light "Black light").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), an uncursed scroll of light illuminates a radius of 11 squares rather than 5. A blessed scroll illuminates the entire level, even areas that are not within line of sight. Otherwise, scrolls of light use the same behavior as NetHack 3.7.0.

## References
